entry.title: Re: Moving Dimension Comment to the far right of my table...
entry.content:
@nlrkg 

I think since dimension comments are bound with visible dimensions on the table, its positions as the first column of the axes of column and row dimension intersection. I don't think its possible to re position it but if you see dimension comment creates a formula like below. May be you could try inserting a empty column manually at end at placing the formula which gets created by inserting the dimension comment. Mostly it would not work but worth giving it a try.

=DIMCOMMENT([D/ENTITY],[D/PRODUCT],[D/ACCOUNT])

Hope this helps !

Nikhil

entry.title: WIND entries deleted daily â€“ cause RWDPOSRS_OLD?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am facing an issue with WIND entries related to document category 55 for POS outbound. These entries are being deleted daily, and I suspect this is caused by the report RWDPOSRS_OLD, which we have scheduled to run daily.

I understand that RWDPOSRS_OLD deletes WIND entries, but I am not sure how the program decides which entries to delete. Has anyone experienced this issue or can provide insights on how to determine if and why the doc category 55 entries are being deleted?

Thank you in advance for your support!

entry.title: Want to start create purchase order on Public cloud 5D2
entry.content:
About 5D2, the process begins with a sales order placed by a customer on the selling company . The system then automatically creates a purchase order whereby the selling company orders the materials from the delivering company .
My client want to start purchase order whereby the selling company orders the materials from the delivering company. They also want the selling company to operate goods receipt process.
Can you advise how can we arrange this function?

entry.title: How to retrieve open AR items including partial payments in Custom CDS View (same as F0711)?
entry.content:
Title:
How to retrieve open AR items including partial payments in Custom CDS View (same as F0711)?
Body:
Objective:
I need to create a custom CDS view that retrieves the same open AR line items as the standard Fiori app F0711 (Manage Customer Line Items) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
Current Situation:
I'm using I_JournalEntryOperationalView as the primary data source with the following WHERE clause:


ClearingDate = '00000000'
AND IsOpenItemManaged = 'X'
AND (AccountingDocumentType = 'RV'
OR AccountingDocumentType = 'DR')
```

**Problem:**
This condition works for most cases, but **it excludes items with partial payments**. When a partial payment is posted, the `ClearingDate` field gets populated (e.g., '20230713'), even though the item still has an outstanding balance.

**Example:**
- Journal Entry: 1800000000
- Line Item: 000001
- `ClearingDate`: '20230713' (not '00000000')
- `IsOpenItemManaged`: 'X'
- Status in F0711: **Open (Clearing Status = 2)**
- Status in my CDS View: **Excluded** (due to ClearingDate filter)

**Question:**
Which field(s) should I use to correctly identify open items including partially cleared items, matching the logic of F0711?

I've tried:
- `ClearingJournalEntry` (empty check)
- `ClearingAccountingDocument` (empty check)
- `ReceivableFinancingStatus` (not populated in our system)

**Additional Info:**
- System: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
- Data Source: `I_JournalEntryOperationalView`
- Fiori App: F0711 - Manage Customer Line Items

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Re: How to trigger custom logic after F-44 clearing document is posted (BTE/BAdI/User-Exit)?
entry.content: Have you checked whether a Workflow Event is raised when the document is posted? Activate Workflow Event logging in transaction SWELS, then post a document using F-44. Afterwards, check which Events were triggered in transaction SWEL. If there is a suitable event, then you can use this as your hook. Set up an Event Linkage using transaction SWE2 and a function module can be called after the Accounting Document is posted and committed.

entry.title: Re: What is the Table for Stock-in-Transit quantity ?
entry.content:
T-Code: MB5TD - Stock in Transit as per Key Date, and MB5T - Current Dated Stock in Transit. 

Table: MARC-TRAME

entry.title: SAP SD Rebates migration to SAP S4 HANA Settlement Management Open Agreements
entry.content:
My client is migrating from ECC to S/4HANA. They are using both standard rebates and Vistex solution for their business.
SAP recommends to close any open agreements through final settlement and create anew in S/4HANA. My concern is for the open agreements which are only partially through their validity period.
Has anyone carried out the migration of open agreements for rebate and Vistex? What is the approach that can be adopted?

entry.title: Re: Onboarding not initiating for International transfer
entry.content:
Hi Gopinath

This issue is for a single user and upon further analysis we found that this error is coming because the business team have initiated international transfer (Onboarding) for the user without terminating the user from existing LE.

And now, they have terminated the user (Future dated termination) and also set the Start date for NLD (Start date> Term date).

But still BPE tile is showing this error. Please let us know how we can fix this issue.

entry.title: Re: SAPUI5 Rich Text Editor Custom File & Image Upload Handler
entry.content:
Hi @js2,

I don't think such extensions would be supported on the macro building blocks. Upon checking the API reference of the  BuildingBlock there seems to be no event available for the BeforeEditorInit available for the control. Hence, I believe we wont be able to customise the TinyMCE initialisation at the first place.

Please let me know if you find any updates regarding the same.

entry.title: SAP BW CompositeProvider join limitation with mixed join dimensions (WBS TOP and Fiscal Year)
entry.content: Is it possible in SAP BW CompositeProviders to model a join scenario within a single CompositeProvider where data provider 1 and data provider 2 are joined using WBS TOP (non time-dependent), while data provider 2 and data provider 3 are joined using Fiscal Year (time-dependent)?

entry.title: SAP J4C Application & benefits in Implementation projects
entry.content:
*Quantifiable benefits described in numbers below are purely based on my project experience & may change based on type of project (Conversion/Greenfield/brownfield), size of project, number of modules implemented & other variables. These are not official numbers prescribed by SAP.

Introduction

The objective of this blog is to cover, how SAP J4C addresses challenges faced by project team in an SAP S/4 HANA private cloud implementation and generate quantifiable benefits. The illustration is strictly based on activate methodology & quantitative benefits are described per SAP Activate phase.  Following personas and SAP activate tasks are considered for illustration purpose and may change based on project. Sample prompts are added to address real-time problems encountered during implementation.

  • SAP Activate Project Manager
  • Functional & Technical architect
  • Business process functional consultant
  • Project Lead
  • Test Manager

Boundary considerations

The SAP Activate methodology is the backbone of every S/4HANA project as considered as implementation methodology. It defines what needs to be done, when, and by whom. This blog is not aimed to explain Activate Methodology, Solution neither business process scenario like procure to pay, hire to retire. Below analysis is limited to SAP S/4HANA private cloud, to provide a structure how to leverage SAP J4C in SAP S/4HANA private cloud greenfield implementation. Used J45 & 19J best practice scope item just as an example to fire prompt & for illustration perspective. On a project management journey, it may be required to fragment prompts due to words limit of output.

Why J4C

Let us start with highlighting day to day challenges, faced by SAP project team:

  • High dependency on SME
  • Long analysis cycles
  • Repetitive tasks
  • Delays in clarifications
  • Knowledge gaps across modules
  • Slow decision-making
  • Heavy documentation load
  • Manual effort in design, testing & cutover planning

This is where SAP J4C can act as force multiplier at address above challenges.

Why & when to use J4C

Below is the SAP Activate phase-by-phase benefit illustration of SAP J4C & quantifiable impact in terms of saving time, effort & quality of deliverables.

Discover Phase

Discover phase sets the foundation for the entire SAP program, SAP J4C supplements appropriate solution positioning, improves value assessment & organize fragmented customer inputs to drive base scope. SAP J4C is instrumental in translating business language into SAP process language to freeze scope.

Activate Task

Sample prompts

Output & KPIs

Pre-sales & Sales partners is expected to present â€“ Business case for SAP S/4HANA product & implementation with ROI models, net present value, payback period scenarios to customer.

Customer is evaluating SAP S/4HANA as ERP solution and implement SAP S/4HANA private cloud. to back up implementation business decision, make a business case and illustrate ROI models, net present value, payback period scenarios.

Â·         Present ROI tree

Â·         Scenario Analysis - (Conservative/Base/Optimistic scenario)

Â·         Risk Assessment & Mitigation, Sensitivity Analysis

Â·         Implementation timelines & milestones with duration

Resulting in 20â€“30% faster business case creation.

Pre-sales & Sales partners to perform value Assessments and suggests industry KPIs, benchmarking stats, SAP industry value drivers

 

Justify value drivers of SAP S/4 HANA in explore phase by performing industry level benchmarking with facts & figure and potential SAP value drivers. Please keep above context & co-relate your output while performing industry benchmarking.

 

Â·         Industry benchmarking of current state Industry Analysis (Legacy System Performance Metrics vs Digital Transformation Maturity)

Â·         S/4HANA Value Driver Analysis

(Core Value Drivers with Industry Benchmarks, Technology Performance Gains, Industry-Specific Value Drivers)

Â·         Financial Impact Benchmarking (Industry ROI Patterns, Cost Structure Benchmarks)

Â·         Risk-Adjusted Value Assessment

20% more aligned value assessment report with SAP Best Practices

Pre-sales & Sales partners to generates transformation scenario roadmaps (Big Bang Vs Phased Rollout Vs Hybrid Coexistence Model) with dependencies for SAP S/4 HANA private cloud implementation

Generate transformation roadmap for S/4 HANA private cloud considering multiple scenario roadmaps with dependencies and pros & cons of each transformation journey for S/4 HANA private cloud implementation

 

Â·         Transformation Framework Overview

Â·         Scenario Analysis (Big Bang Vs Phased Rollout Vs Hybrid Coexistence Model) with Approach Overview

Â·         Dependencies/ Pros & Cons of approaches Analysis

Â·         Sample implementation plan with timelines

30% faster decision making in terms of decision (Big Bang Vs Phases Vs hybrid implementation approach)

 

Prepare Phase

SAP Joule for Consultants (J4C) Accelerates translation of vision defined in discover phase into execution readiness. SAP J4C crystalizes project plan, defines clear ownership and establishes alignment on landscape, test, data, and integration strategies.

Activate Task

Sample prompts

Output & KPIs

Project Manager need to create a project plan WBS Structure preferably to auto-populate task from SAP Activate methodology.

The project implementation is currently in SAP Activate prepare phase of S/4HANA private cloud implementation. It is required to create a project plan to govern & track WBS task. Please generate a project plan with work break down structure containing SAP Activate task along with columns to capture timelines, effort, role and dependencies.

Â·         SAP Activate Project WBS Template

With provision to capture timelines/effort/role/dependencies of all Activate Task.

Â·         Highlight risk & dependency.

Note â€“ For CALM customers, project plan WBS structure is available & is based on type of project selected.

 

 

 

 

20% faster project plan creation with WBS.

Project team may need project kick-off deck, with defined scope, timelines & resource loading.

, SSB and governance model

As part of S/4HANA private cloud implementation a project manager is expected to create kick-off slides, List down important content to be added in kick-off deck.

Â·         List important content to be added in kick-off deck.

Note: Directs user to SAP process navigator where Activate project kick-off slides are added as accelerator.

 

Reduces PM effort in prepare phase by 10%

Project manager also needs to outline assignment of task with appropriate RACI, RAID and establish a Communication Plan

 

A project manager intent to create communication plan during prepare phase of S/4HANA private cloud implementation. As part of the communication plan, it is important to clearly highlight RACI matrix involving all personas defined in activate methodology.

Â·         Draft communication plan derived by SAP Activate methodology.

Â·         RACI matrix for stakeholder management

 

 

20% reduction in building communication plan.

Project Manager, Solution Lead, Functional Consultant to make Fit to Workshops schedule with clear agenda, questionnaires, slides, demo scripts

For an SAP S/4HANA private implementation with following scenarios in scope Order-to-Cash (O2C), Procure-to-Pay (P2P) , Plan-to-Produce (PP) Manufacturing Process Record-to-Report (R2R) Finance Process Hire-to-Retire (H2R) HR Process Forecast-to-Fulfil Process Acquire-to-Retire (A2R) Asset Management Project-to-Delivery (P2D) Project Management I want to conduct fit to standard work, can you please create a workshop invite template with following details date & duration, scope items, short business benefits of scope items, Attendees in a tabular structure.

 

Â·         Workshop template, overview & schedule

Â·         Process Scope & Business Benefits of SAP best practice scope item.

 

20% improvement in consultant prep-work & focussed workshop structure

A technical architect to define customer landscape strategy including system infrastructure, environmental system composition etc.

 

A technical consultant/SAP basis consultant is expected to design system landscape strategy, sizing in for S/4 HANA private cloud implementation. List down activities to be part of system landscape strategy document along with Ariba used for procurement and sourcing, concur for travel & expense management.

 

Â·         Infrastructure Requirements Definition (CPU cores/Memory/Storage)

Â·         System Requirements Matrix

Â·         Environment Management Strategy

Â·         Performance & Monitoring Strategy

(CPU utilization threshold, Annual growth projections)

Â·         Disaster Recovery & Business Continuity

Â·         Security & Compliance Framework

 

20% faster landscape planning.

Integration architects need to define system Integration Strategy of SAP & non-sap system in customer landscape.

 

 

 

 

 

An integration consultant/SAP BTP consultant is expected to design system integration strategy for S/4 HANA private cloud implementation. List down activities to be part of system integration strategy document along with Ariba used for procurement and sourcing, concur for travel & expense management.

 

Â·         Integration plan overview (Objective, Scope, Integration Principles)

Â·         Integration Landscape Assessment (Real-time API, Batch, Real-time)

Â·         Integration Architecture Design

(Event Mesh, REST APIs, SFTP with transformation)

Â·         Integration Design Ex - S/4HANA to Ariba & Concur

Â·         SAP BTP Integration Platform Configuration

Â·         Suggests integration patterns (AIF, BTP, CPI)

Â·         Data Transformation & Mapping

 

10â€“15% drop in integration design strategy

Creates ETL approach document with data migration plan and executive summary (scope, approach & success criteria)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

A data migration consultant is looking to draft data migration strategy at various implementation of phase of SAP S/4HANA private cloud implementation. List down activities to be part of system data migration plan document for S/4 HANA private implementation including ETL, load waves & cutover design of sandbox, development & quality system.

Â·         Migration Strategy Definition (Legacy System data Inventory)

Â·         ETL Tool Evaluation (SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit, SAP Data Services, Custom ABAP/BDC)

Â·         Data Analysis, Preparation and

Load Wave Design (Wave â€“ 1 Master data, Wave 2 â€“ Configuration data, Wave 3 â€“ Open Tx Wave 4 - Historical Transactions)

 

Win rate of 40% for data migration clarity

Apart from above highlighted deliverables, SAP Joule for consultant can be useful in drafting templates for RAID log, Project charter & change management & security role design strategy.

Explore Phase

SAP J4C facilitate functional consultant in performing Fit-to-Standard workshops, Business process mapping, Requirements capture & deltas, Backlog creation, Solution design & architecture. It also helps in creation of functional specs & interface specs and chalk out Integration, data, security design. This is the most documentation-heavy phaseâ€”and SAP J4C provides massive acceleration.

Activate Task

Sample prompts

Output & KPIs

SAP Functional Consultant need to do fit-to-standard preparation before a workshop.

SAP functional consultant is planning to conduct fit to standard workshop during explore phase for SAP S/4HANA private cloud implementation. As part of fit to standard workshop preparation consultant needs pre-read of solution scope, solution specific questionnaire, create backlog template etc. before actual fit-to-standard workshop during explore phase.

 

 

Prompt 2 - A functional consultant is planning to conduct fit to standard workshop during explore phase for SAP S/4HANA private cloud implementation. As part of fit to standard workshop preparation consultant needs pre-read of procurement & sourcing SAP best practice scope J45 & 19J. Generate pre-reads document for J45 & 19J.

Â·         Generates pre-read documents. (Business process description, standard process flow, pre-requisites (master data, configuration data etc.), Integration & process dependencies between J45 & 19J

Â·         Refer to process-level questions as accelerator as part Activate methodology.

Â·         Backlog item template

 

30% reduction in workshop preparation time, 70-80% completeness in requirement coverage and zero duplication of backlog items

Post fit-to-standard functional consultant is expected to draft user stories based on workshop discussion with customer assuming workshop is recorded & meeting text transcript is available.

Fit to standard workshop is recorded & converted to below text transcript, as a next step functional consultant is expected to create user stories in the format â€œAs an SAP Personas, I want to perform task to achieve process improvement KPI.â€ Create user stories from below text script of fit to standard workshop of SAP S/4 HANA requisitioning process. ""Text Transcript""

 

Â·         Automation of User Story generation

Â·         Based on fit-to-standard workshop text transcripts.

Â·         Generate User stories in customer specific format like â€œAs an SAP Personas, I want to perform task to achieve process improvement KPI.â€

Â·         Propose Acceptance criteria per user story.

Â·         Next Steps proposals

 

20% faster user story creation with high adherence to customer user story template.

Next logical step is to automate creation of a functional specification based on logically linked user stories.

 

 

Based on user stories 1, 3, & 4 create functional specifications segregate them based on type of WRICEF objects

 

Â·         Produce first cut of RICEFW functional specs.

Â·         Generate interface mapping tables

Â·         Suggest WRICEF complexity level (High/Med/Low)

Â·         Create test cases linked to requirement IDs

Â·         Generate pseudo code / flow charts for developers

20% faster functional spec writing & 25% fewer developer clarifications resulting in 15% reduction in rework cycle time

Supporting documents (Coding standards, Error/Exception handling)

Prompt 1 - Create technical ABAP naming convention document for all ABAP objects like class, reports etc. to make sure developers adhere to naming convention.

 

Â·         Naming convention document

Â·         Exception Handling Framework (Runtime/Validation/Authorization Errors) for WRICEF developments.

Â·         SAP BTP vs CPI vs API Hub recommendations

 

Realize Phase â€“ Build, Test & Validate Faster

SAP Joule for Consultants (J4C) streamlines configuration and development by guiding consultants with SAP Best Practicesâ€“aligned setups and standard extensibility patterns, reducing rework and over-customization. It accelerates unit testing, SIT, and UAT preparation by generating test scenarios, validating process coverage, and ensuring traceability from Fit-to-Standard decisions to test cases.

Activate Task

Sample prompts

Output & KPIs

Functional consultant needs configuration guidance to setup system based on customer requirements.

SAP materials management functional consultant plan to start system configuration in development system for S/4 HANA private implementation. List important steps to kickstart system configuration in SAP MM module.

 

Â·         Pre-Configuration Prerequisites

Â·         Organizational Structure Setup

Â·         Master Data Configuration

Â·         Procurement Process Configuration

Â·         Inventory Management Setup

Â·         Invoice Verification Configuration & Integration Points

10â€“15% faster system configuration.

Functional consultant to write Functional specification & technical consultant to realize requirements with TS & development support

Requirement specific Prompt*

Â·         Guide ABAP class, CDS Views, workflow events, BTP event Mesh patterns, OData service structure & enhancement exits, BADIs

Â·         Draft functional specs with above inputs

Â·         WRICEF complexity classification (High/Med/Low)

KPI

Â·         20% fewer defects in unit testing

Â·         20% reduction in development effort

Â·         40% faster functional spec writing

Â·         25% fewer developer clarifications

Â·         15% reduction in rework cycle time

Test Case generation from user stories.

Create a test script based on user stories highlighted below

â€œâ€ As a Requisitioner, I want to add "Stage of Material" as a custom field in purchase requisitions & perform validation against values maintained in material master attributes. So that additional product attributes are captured enabling 100% material classification accuracy and improved supplier selectionâ€â€

 

Â·         Auto-generate test scripts from user stories

Â·         Create SIT & UAT readiness reports

 

20% to 30 reductions in test-case creation time and Reduce UAT sign-off time (20â€“30%)

               

 

Clean core guidance

Check below code follows clean core principles

Â·         Higher Clean core adherence

Â·         Save upgrade cost

 

 

Deploy & Run phase â€“ Optimize Cutover, Handover & Go-Live

J4C supports data migration, OCM, and cutover by structuring migration objects, sequencing activities, and aligning change impacts and readiness go-live checklists with Activate milestones. Finally, it simplifies documentation and training creation by auto-structuring role-based content directly from approved SAP processes and solution designs. Key Activate Tasks being facilitated by J4C during run phase Hypercare readiness, Handover to support & Production validation

Activate Task

Sample prompts

Output & KPIs

Cutover manager must prepare a cutover Plan containing task during deployment phase.

As part of cut-over & SAP activate deploy phase activities for SAP private cloud implementation, List down tasks, sequence task & assign ownership considering deployment duration is 3 days.

Â·         Draft cutover plan by workstream (MM/FI/Technical etc.)

Â·         Outlines inter dependencies

Â·         Draft hourly go-live activity list

Â·          Clear task sequencing

30% reduction in drafting cutover plan

Run phase preparation

Future release adoption,

Training & user support

Monitoring & optimization

 

For the SAP private cloud implementation postproduction go-live, generate SOP template, Incidence tracking report, SLAâ€™s template for incidences tracking & assignment.

Â·         Draft SOP

Â·         Incident creation template

Â·         Draft SLAs for incidences

Â·         Draft Weekly/Daily status reports

 

25â€“30% faster ticket resolution and future ready for upcoming releases & innovations

Impact Summary

SAP Personas

SAP J4C Impact area

Quantitative Benefits

Functional Consultant

Fit-to-standard, specs, test scripts

15â€“20% effort reduction

Technical Consultant / ABAP

Code patterns, CDS/OData, unit tests

10â€“20% fewer defects

Technical/Integration Architect

E2E design, integration patterns

5â€“10% architecture consistency boost

Project Manager

WBS, RAID, governance, PMO artifacts

Saves 8â€“12 hours/week

Basis / Security

Sizing summaries, role mapping, cutover prep

15% faster planning cycles

Data Lead

Mapping templates, validation rules

Up to 50% faster prep

OCM Lead

Training docs, FAQs, communication

20â€“30% faster doc creation

 

Conclusion: Why every SAP project must use SAP J4C

SAP J4C is not a replacement for SAP consulting fraternityâ€”it is an amplifier. It reduces manual documentation, accelerates analysis, enhances solution quality, and frees consultants to focus on client advisory rather than repetitive tasks.

By embedding SAP J4C into every SAP Activate phase, organizations gain a measurable competitive advantageâ€”shorter timelines, improved quality, and smoother delivery.

entry.title: Croatia billing/posting date vs creation/issue date #COE#SW01
entry.content:
S4Hana Public Cloud 2508 2SL. Due to Croatia Fiscalization 2.0 "The invoice date must match the XML submission date, meaning both occur on the same calendar day" 

When issuing billing documents in January 2026 some have the service rendered/delivery date in December 2025. Last year wasn't a problem because we didn't have fiscalization. We issued invoices in January 2025 with the billing date and service rendered date 31.12.2024. This accounted for the revenue and VAT in tax year 2024.

If the invoice date must be the same as the issue date (January 2026) then the journal entry date and posting date will also be January 2026. This means the revenue and VAT get recognized in 2026, but our accountants say it must be posted to the output invoice book (I-RA) for December. VAT is reported in the VAT form for December Tax Administration.

How can we issue an invoice in January 2026 with January 2026 billing date, but posting date 2025 so the VAT is accounted for in the previous year/period?

entry.title: Calculating surcharges on contract manufacturing
entry.content:
Hello,

entry.title: Re: Croatia billing/posting date vs creation/issue date #...
entry.content:
Since configuration alone cannot override fiscalization rules, you need to handle this via accounting processes:

1. Accruals / Period-End Adjustments
Post manual accruals in December 2025 for revenue and VAT related to services rendered in December. Use period-end closing activities (accrual engine or manual journal entries). This ensures VAT is reported in Decemberâ€™s VAT return, even though the invoice is issued in January.

2. Advance Billing / Proforma
Issue a December proforma or advance invoice (non-fiscalized) to record VAT and revenue in 2025. Then issue the fiscalized invoice in January 2026 with reference to the December document. This requires careful reconciliation to avoid double taxation.

3. Split Process
Delivery/Service Date = December 2025 â†’ post accruals for VAT/revenue. Invoice Date = January 2026 â†’ fiscalized invoice submission. This way, accounting books reflect December VAT, while fiscalization compliance is maintained.

entry.title: Re: "Execute in Background" function in the Add. List for...
entry.content:
Please note that the option â€œExecute in Backgroundâ€ is greyed out by design in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Background execution of classic batch input sessions (as used in ECC or On-Premise systems) is not supported in the Cloud environment for technical and security reasons.

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, all such processes are intended to be handled through scheduled jobs, rather than interactive background execution.

Please refer to the below KBA for more information.

KBA - ##3672588 - â€œExecute in Backgroundâ€ greyed out for GST report; how to run Advance Return for Tax on Sales/Purchases in background.

entry.title: Re: SAP SD Rebates migration to SAP S4 HANA Settlement Ma...
entry.content:
In S/4HANA migrations, open rebate agreements (both standard and Vistex) cannot be carried forward directly; the recommended approach is to perform a final settlement in ECC and then create new agreements in S/4HANA. For partially valid agreements, you need to either close them and reâ€‘establish in S/4 or use a controlled data migration approach with Vistex tools to replicate conditions and balances.

This is also taking into below key considerations

  • Standard SAP rebates in ECC are replaced in S/4HANA by Condition Contracts (Settlement Management). This is a different functionality altogether
  • Vistex agreements require migration to the S/4HANAâ€‘optimized Vistex extensions, which have redesigned engines for HANA.
  • SAPâ€™s official recommendation: close all open agreements in ECC (via final settlement) before migration.
  • Challenge: agreements midâ€‘validity period (e.g., Janâ€“Dec 2025) where migration occurs midâ€‘year.

entry.title: Re: Run Statutory Reports app: GSTR3b & GSTR2B
entry.content:
Dear all,

 

Kindly ensure that statutory reports are properly configured using the â€œSetting Up Your Statutory Reportingâ€ configuration activity. Please refer to the following SAP Help document for detailed guidance:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/4de200b26d5d42bbacae69c6bf6b9923/331dd0bd74fe480087e1deeec032aea0.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=LATEST

 

For specific information related to the GSTR-3B report, please refer to the help document below:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/634261119fec4d58970471f2c4a9a740/39974242269841778f2728247d22e9d7.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

 

Additionally, please review KBA 3428743 â€“ â€œTax Items data coming blank in GSTR-3B report, which provides guidance on configuring Tax Box Mappings for the GSTR-3B (Legacy) report.

 

It is also important to maintain correct source document types and ensure that only relevant information is included for GSTR-2A, IMS, and GSTR-2B consistency checks. These source document types are also considered for GSTR-3B reporting, particularly for Input Tax Credit (ITC) determination.

GSTR-2B is an auto-drafted ITC statement generated for every normal taxpayer based on data submitted by suppliers in their respective GSTR-1/IFF, GSTR-5 (Non-Resident Taxable Person), and GSTR-6 (Input Service Distributor) returns. The statement reflects the availability or non-availability of ITC for each supplier document. Following the introduction of IMS, it is also possible to regenerate the GSTR-2B statement.

For more information, please refer to the following SAP Help document:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/634261119fec4d58970471f2c4a9a740/c9985d76aa004586937be8d85504900b.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

 

Best regards,

Atanu

SAP Support - S/4HANA Cloud

entry.title: Learn SAP Business Data Cloud in the virtual classroom
entry.content:
Since the launch of SAP Business Data Cloud we provided a self-study course Introducing SAP Business Data Cloud on our learning platform to help you develop foundation skills in this in-demand solution.

However, there are learners who prefer to develop their skills in a classroom environment with other learners, guided by an expert instructor. 

If this is you, then we have the solution:  Introducing SAP Business Data Cloud (Instructor-led Class).

This 4 hour virtual classroom course follows the same structure as the self-study version, but the content is presented by an expert SAP instructor who will use an SAP Business Data Cloud system to bring things to life with plenty of demonstrations. Throughout the course you can ask questions and join in discussions with your fellow learners. In addition, you will be provided with a portable, digital course handbook. 

So if social learning is your preferred way to develop skills, then join us in the virtual classroom so we can help you quickly develop your skills in SAP Business Data Cloud.

entry.title: Re: Croatia billing/posting date vs creation/issue date #...
entry.content:
Hi @Lakshmipathi, thanks so much for the quick reply. I have fed this back to our accountants, but they got this answer from ai.

Yes, the SAP ERP system is designed to support VAT posting by Tax Reporting Date or Tax Fulfillment Date, which is in accordance with Croatian VAT laws. SAP allows the separation of the invoice date from the date when the tax liability actually arose, using different dates in its modules: Tax Reporting Date/Tax Fulfillment Date: This is the key date for VAT calculation. In SAP, this date (often on the invoice line item) is used to determine the tax period to which the posting belongs, e.g. December 2025. Booking Date: This date determines the financial period in the general ledger (e.g. January 2026). Invoice Date: This is the date printed on the invoice itself (e.g. January 2, 2026).

How it works in practice within SAP: When entering an incoming or outgoing invoice, the user enters the invoice date, but it is crucial to correctly specify the tax date (date of service performance, 12/31/2025 in your case). SAP uses this tax date to generate legally required reports for the Tax Administration, such as VAT and U-RA forms, ensuring that the transaction is included in the correct tax period (December). SAP's Document and Reporting Compliance solutions are specifically tailored to Croatian regulations, including mandatory fiscalization 2.0 and e-invoices that came into effect in 2026, ensuring that the system can meet all local legal requirements.

In our S4Hana setup, we have configured the tax reporting date to be determined by the billing document date. Using a different date in service rendered date has no impact. But I notice we can change the Tax Reporting Date in Run Statutory Reports > Manage Tax Items for Legal Reporting and include a January invoice (Billing date 06.01.2026, Service Rendered Date 31/12/2025) in the December VAT return. Is this the solution we should go for? Although it still requires a journal to accrue the revenue in December rather than January

entry.title: Accessing a Build Work Zone Application Directly (Without Header)
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

Recently, I received the following requirement:

Requirement

The customer wants to access a single application in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition directly, without navigating through the Work Zone home page.

Key expectations:

  • Users should be able to access a specific Work Zone application directly.

  • The Work Zone application may point to any backend application, such as:

    • Web Dynpro ABAP (WDA)

    • SAP UI5 / Fiori app

    • BW reports

    • Third-party applications

  • Users should only see the content of the backend application.

  • The Work Zone header should not be visible.

  • Typical use case:

    • A user receives an email notification (for example, for an approval).

    • Clicking Approve or Reject redirects the user directly to the relevant application.

 

Analysis

After analyzing the requirement, I identified two main parts:

  1. Hide or remove the Work Zone header

  2. Access the application directly using a semantic object and action

 

Solution

1. Hide the Work Zone Header

To hide the header area of the Work Zone, append the following URL parameter at the end of the URL:

sap-ushell-config=headerless

 

2. Access the Application Directly

To launch the application directly, append the semantic object and action to the URL:

##<semantic-object>-<action>

The semantic object and action can be obtained from the application configuration in Build Work Zone.

 

Final URL Example

https://<subaccount>.launchpad.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/site/workzone-std-qa?sap-ushell-config=headerless#<semantic-object>-<action>

 

Result

With this configuration:

  • The Work Zone header is hidden.

  • Users are taken directly to the target backend application.

  • The experience is seamless and ideal for approval or notification-based use cases.

Below is the scren shot for reference:

 

I hope this helps others who are looking to access Work Zone applications directly without exposing the home page or header.

Please feel free to comment and share your thoughts.

 

Regards,
Rohit Gera

entry.title: How to get recorded working time or working days of timesheet in time off take rule?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have time tracking enabled instance.

We have a requirement in employee central time off.

We have a group of employees who works continuously for 50 days without week offs. After working continuously for 48 to 50 days, then they will apply for a leave of 10 days, for that we have a leave type called "work break". 

If the employee failed to complete at least 48 days of work then system should restrict them while applying the leave.

Example:- If the employee wish to request leave from 1st November 2025 for 10 days, then that employee has to work for 48 to 50 days before the start date of the leave. then only the employee can request leave from 1st Nov 2025 to 10th Nov 2025. If the employee failed to work minimum 48 days before 1st Nov 2025 as per work schedule, then system should restrict the employee while requesting "Work Break Leave".

As we have timesheet implemented, the attendance data of the employee is getting recorded in the timesheet.

Please suggest me that how can I read the recorded working time or working days data from the timesheet data of the employee by using the time off take rule to check the attendance recorded in the period from (-50 days of 1st Nov 2025) to (1st Nov 2025).

Many Thanks

SAH

entry.title: Process Resource in SAP Digital Manufacturing: The Small Flag That Can Make or Break Your Shop Floor
entry.content:
Introduction

In SAP Digital Manufacturing, some of the most powerful behaviors are controlled by very small configuration switches, and the 'Process Resource' flag is a great example of that.

It defines whether a started SFC is owned by the resource or by the user ID who started it, which seems a minor detail, but can make all the difference in your process flow, as this single flag can give a lot of flexibility, enable team-based execution, and much more.

What is a 'Process Resource'?

The Process Resource flag controls who owns a started SFC. You have two options:

Process Resource = Yes

  • The SFC is assigned to the resource
  • One operator can start the SFC
  • A different operator can finish the SFC

Process Resource = No (default)

  • The SFC is assigned to the user ID
  • The same user who starts the SFC must also complete it

Example 1: Team-Based Workstation

You have a packing station where:

  • Operator A starts the SFC in the morning
  • Operator B takes over after shift change and finishes it

In this case, Process Resource must be = Yes.

Why?
Because the SFC is owned by the resource, not by Operator A.
Anyone working on that resource can continue the work.

This is how you enable:

  • Shift handovers
  • Team-based execution
  • Realistic shop floor flexibility

Example 2: Single-Operator Accountability

You have a quality inspection station where:

  • The same operator must perform the full inspection from start to finish
  • Full traceability per user is required

In this case, Process Resource should be = No.

Why?
Because now the SFC is locked to the user ID.
Only the user who started it can complete it.

This is perfect for:

  • Quality steps
  • Regulatory processes
  • Sensitive operations

IMPORTANT

Changing the Process Resource flag after SFCs have already been started can have serious implications.

For example:

  • If you change from Yes to No
  • Any SFC already started will now be locked to the original user
  • No other operator will be able to complete it

Result:

  • Operators get blocked
  • Production gets stuck
  • Confusion on the shop floor

So the rule is simple: Decide this upfront and avoid changing it mid-stream.

Conclusion

The 'Process Resource' flag may look like a small setting, but in reality, it is a strategic design decision.

It directly defines:

  • How flexible your shop floor is
  • How your operators collaborate
  • How realistic your scenarios feel
  • How smooth your shifts run

This is one of those details that separates an average setup from a truly well-designed, production-ready landscape.

Learn more at Manage Resources.

Do you want to see more content like this? Please live a Kudos!

If you have any questions, please check SAP Community Q&A Area, or comment down below.

Thanks,
Manoel Costa

entry.title: Update US Tax Rates error Valid from date of jur cd &1 is before valid from date in customizing
entry.content:
In Configuration Activity 101016 - Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases or App Upload Tax Rates (F2609) a tax rate needs to be created with validity date prior to that of existing tax rates. 

Error messages if an existing tax rate is changed in the past:

  1. Configuration Activity 101016 - Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases: â€œValid from date of jur cd &1 is before valid from date in customizingâ€.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Update US Tax Rates error Valid from date of jur cd &...
entry.content:
Changing tax rates in the past is always risky, as this will overwrite all future rates. This could lead to incorrect processing of already posted documents. Therefore, it is not allowed by default in the system. 

However, in certain situations, like 0% tax rates and no existing postings, the error messages can be disabled "-". Configuration activity "Message Control in Tax Area" (103887) is to be used to disable the messages 036 (needed for the App Upload Tax Rates (F2609)), 048 (needed for configuration activity â€œDefine Tax Codes for Sales and Purchasesâ€ (101016)) and 078 (needed for the tax rate import into the test/production system) for application area FOT_US_INT_TAX_CALC.

At least the entry for message 078 must already be present in the subsequent system before the tax rate changes are imported. If taxes have already been imported before disabling the message 078, the missing transport requests can be re-imported using the App Import Tax Codes after Transport (TAX_RATE_TRANS). This app only displays the transport requests with US tax rates that have not yet been imported. After import, the transport requests are deleted from the value help list.

Once the changes are made, it is recommended to set the messages back to error "E".

In the public cloud, changes to the finance tax rate must always be made in the customizing tenant and then transported to the other systems.

entry.title: Re: SuccessFactors Time Tracking Integration Guide

entry.title: Re: Generic IDoc Outbound flow in Cloud Integration Pipeline
entry.content:
@slava_kuzyakin I have requirement to use EOIO from CPI to SAP and I am trying to fill: ARCKEY=urn:sap.com:seq=<QueueID>-<QueueCounter>-< Date>-<ReconciliationIndicator>

I sent exactly this:

ARCKEY=urn:sap.com:seq=TEST_QUEUE-0000000001-20260106-Dummy

maybe I misunderstood something in note 1613719:

The components of the ID:

  • urn:sap.com:seq=: Prefix for identifying the ID for in order processing
  • <QueueID>: Queue name, length 32 characters The SAP systems use UUIDs as queue names. This is also recommended for external systems.
  • <QueueCounter>:  IDoc counter within the queue. The counter is defined as a field of the type NUMC and with the length 10.
  • <Date>: Date on which the predecessor IDoc was created in the sending system.
  • <ReconciliationIndicator>: Indicator for identifying IDocs that are exchanged for synchronization purposes. If this indicator is set, the IDoc is transferred to the application regardless of whether or not all of the predecessor IDocs have been successfully processed.

I am not sure if all 4 values are mandatory, what is the format of each filed and also how to store in CPI "table" with columns: queueName|QueueCounter|Date|ReconciliationIndicator

As I have dynamic queue name it makes it more difficult. 

My issue is that when I sent ARCKEY=urn:sap.com:seq=TEST_QUEUE-0000000001-20260106-Dummy IDOCs finished in S4 in status 66: IDoc must be processed later; expected: 0000000001 ; current:

entry.title: Re: My Experience with the New SAP Exam FormatÂ (2026)
entry.content:
Thanks for this insight. All these articles on experience do help.

I attempted the new exam format with success. It is an open book assessment so you could use any resource you would as if in real life scenario. i.e. you could use other LLMs like ChatGPT.

Another lesson learnt was, the exam timer starts from the moment you engage with the Ai assistance. I initially thought it was a pre-assessment ðŸ™‚

entry.title: Re: Different Characteristic value in 'MSC3N' & 'AUSP' table
entry.content:
Hello there

Numeric characteristics are stored as floating points. You therefore need to convert them, for example using fm FLTP_CHAR_CONVERSION (see SAP note 3389927).

entry.title: Re: Unable to find "Maintain Communication Users" or "SAP...
entry.content:
Hi,

 

This is expected behaviour in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition â€“ Trial.

According to SAPâ€™s official trial description: https://www.sap.com/products/erp/s4hana/trial.html

the free trial provides a shared tenant with a limited, preconfigured scope, intended for exploring standard business processes only. Administrative and key-user capabilities are intentionally restricted.

Based on the trial scope described on the SAP page:

  • The trial runs in a shared environment, therefore system-wide administration is disabled
  • Key-user and admin activities are not supported. As a result, apps such as â€œMaintain Communication Usersâ€, â€œCommunication Systemsâ€, and â€œCommunication Arrangementsâ€ are not available
  • Integration with SAP BTP is not offered in this trial

This means that inbound communication scenarios cannot be fully configured in the shared trial, even though you can technically create a Communication Scenario in ADT.

The shared trial content and authorizations are fixed by SAP and cannot be extended or activated manually. This limitation is by design, not a configuration issue.

 

All the best, 

Elena P.

entry.title: Re: SuccessFactors 2H 2025: Seamless Talent Data Transfer from Inactive to Active Employment
entry.content:
Hello ðŸ™‚

we're totally happy with the new feature to transfer the Talent Data from Inactive to Active Employment.

The transfer of the forms works as described, but the ratings are not displayed in our rating portlet in the Employee Profile. So this means, there is no update with the ratings in t he new employment and our HR admins must transfer this manually. 

Do you know this phenomenon? And is that how it should be? We need a complete history of the ratings and a transfer to the new profile.

Regards
Steffi

entry.title: Sequence in Blended Courses
entry.content:
Hello,

Is it possible to create 1 item with online & instructor-led aspect, where the online part needs to be completed before the user can attend a class? I know it's possible create seperate items and make the online item prerequisite to the instructor-led item, but ideally we want this to be part of 1 item. Functionally, the user MUST complete the online object before attending the class. 

Is anyone experienced with such set-ups? 

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: SAC Live reports are not working in incognito mode fo...
entry.content:
In general the incognito or private mode blocks ant pop-ups and 3rd party cookies. Did you check if the SAC URL by any change has a setting in your browser where local network access is blocked?

https://me.sap.com/notes/3677982
